intro: Bonania suborbiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bonania, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
